page.title: 19THE TRAFFIC CENSUS
page.content: On Monday 23rd of September 1985 Haxey C.E. Primary School did a Traffic Census of the A161,which runs from North to south through the village of Haxey.We went out at 10:55 a.m. and came back at 11:55 a.m. In that time no pedestrians passed us and neither did any cyclists.The reason we were doing this project was that in the Epworth Bells (which is our local newspaper)there was a series of letters about the number of lorries that passed through Belton,Epworth, and Haxey.Instead of going down the M18 Motorway lorries were coming off at Belton or joining the Motorway after passing through the villages nearby. People had complained of the dangers,because of the extra lorries. We found that on Monday there weren't too many lorries, from the Belton
